name: Fortune JP Palace

reviews.text: Good Property to choose for a calm stay. I was there from 15th to 17th August 2013 with my family. The entire stay was nice and awesome. Everything planned before hand and the commitment was met out as accepted.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: I had travelled along with my family during the long weekend of Aug 15th, we had booked in adavance and were well attended by the ever smiling door man till the house keeping staff each of them had a genuine smile with a warm namaste.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: The room service was prompt and so were the other requirements which were attended on a timely manner.
reviews.title: Disorganised

reviews.text: Special word of thanks to Front office Manager Binit Kumar, F&B Manager Nicolus Harry, Executive Chef Indranil Roy and Duty Manager Annamalai who were cordial enough to visit us during our stay and ensure that our needs were being attended too.
reviews.title: Nice to stay

reviews.text: The food festival of delhi street food was good with the amazing spread and so were the breakfast spread... I would highly recommend the hotel. The Rooms were big enough and well equipped and an exemplary staff made our stay a blessed one.
reviews.title: Family break in Mysore

reviews.text: I had been to Mysore for a weekend trip with family. Our stay at Fortune JP Palace was truly awesome. The ambiance is very appealing like a typical five-star hotel. Right from cleanliness to room service to in room dining, everything was spot on. The hotel is centrally located which is the key. The staff are very warm and courteous.
reviews.title: Awesome place for a short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have a really cool swimming pool especially if you have kids and want some time to relax. The changing rooms are very well-maintained. The food was simply superb. They have a huge spread for buffet breakfast. The restaurant was packed during breakfast time but the staff was able to manage the crowd very well. We didn't have to wait too long.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: A discounted price of Rs 4000 plus taxes for a five-star property is absolute value for money. But this includes only breakfast. They can offer an all-meal package which would be ideal for a weekend trip. Otherwise, you end up spending a lot on food which works out to be expensive. There was some bit of cost cutting as they were a little stingy with extras such as soaps, creams, buckets in the bathrooms. But they would gladly provide when asked for it. We had opted for double occupancy so they had joined two single beds instead of one double bed. We were not very impressed. But since the rooms were good value for money, we didn't feel too bad.
reviews.title: Good business hotel in Mysore

reviews.text: They don't have too many activities for children. But unless you are going to spend most of the time at the hotel, you don't need any activities for children.
reviews.title: Wi-fi is a joke and hotel has some crazy local policies

reviews.text: The travel desk is not very good especially if you want help with local sightseeing. They are not able to guide you or give you the right suggestions.
reviews.title: Comfortable Rooms - Nice Location

reviews.text: Had a short stay here when I couldn't make it to Bandipur before the gates closed. I didn't expect much, making a last minute arrangement for the evening, so was very surprised at this. The hotel is modern. Rooms are very well maintained and spotlessy clean. Breakfast was excellent. The rooms were quiet and dark, allowing for restful sleep. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Fortune JP Palace is one nice place to hold or conduct your review, quarterly or annual meetings. Its quite spacious considering Mysore City. The food and ambiance is quite good. The Chef does not miss the local flavor, by which I am trying to say, the food is not bland. It is centrally located and you can access any direction without much fuss or strain.
reviews.title: A simple place for your meetings with appropriate food

reviews.text: Fortune JP Palace is a nice hotel. It is a new hotel and a good one to stay in Mysore. Its rooms are good. Very nice restaurant and good food with wide spread. Its in the centre of Mysore from where market, Mysore Palace and Brindavan Garden are not far, all are nearby. We stayed here for 1 night on our way to Ooty from Bangalore.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is perfect for stay with family/business.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: Stayed here with family for 3 night. The location is perfect near to the palace.
reviews.title: Decent hotel in Mysore

reviews.text: This had to be one of the best hotels in Mysore, in this price range.
reviews.title: Nice property with adequate amenities!

reviews.text: Absolute value for money as they have almost all the amenities you can ask for in a 5 starer. Gym, pool, spa, 3 restaurants, great location.
reviews.title: very nice hotel in the middle of Mysore

reviews.text: Rooms are spacious nd designed like almost any other Fortune.
reviews.title: Good Deal from Cleartrip

description: Ideally located opposite the government guest house Fortune JP Palace is well-connected to all nearby tourist attractions. Just 2kms from the famous Mysore Palace, 3kms from the railway station and 12kms from the Mysore airport, the hotel delights the guests with its excellent range of guest facilities like Spa, Swimming Pool, Chinese restaurant, rooftop barbecue, all day dining coffee shop, shopping arcade. It provides 108 well-appointed guest rooms including Deluxe, Club, suites, 01 room for the differently abled. Most of them have a soaring view of the magnificent Chamundi Hills. The interiors of the rooms have been aesthetically done in contemporary style decor, and our well-equipped with an excellent range of amenities required by a modern day traveler.
